en: Mr Wood came to the door and spoke to Tony's mother.
zh: 伍德先生来到门口，跟托尼的妈妈说了会儿话。

en: Please give him a job, Mr Wood.
zh: 伍德先生，请给他一份工作吧。

en: You are a pain in my neck!
zh: 你真是个麻烦精！

en: I cannot leave home even for a moment.
zh: 我一刻也离不开家。

en: I went past my stop absent-mindedly.
zh: 我走神了，坐过站了。

en: A slip of the tongue often brings about unexpected results.
zh: 说漏嘴经常会引起意想不到的后果。

en: I carelessly allowed the door to stand open.
zh: 我粗心大意没关门。

en: I made a careless mistake.
zh: 我犯了个低级错误。

en: I forgot to bring the book. It just slipped my mind.
zh: 我忘了带那本书，完全给忘了。

en: Uh-oh. He knew I was lying - saw right through me. I didn't know what to say.
zh: 哎呀，他知道我在撒谎——一眼就把我给看穿了。我当时都不知道该说什么。

en: Whoo! I'm feeling that sake. I'm getting blurred vision and it's hard to walk.
zh: 喔！这清酒后劲儿真大。我眼睛都花了，路也走不稳。

en: She wanted to return home, but she got lost.
zh: 她想回家，结果迷路了。

en: We will have some guests tomorrow.
zh: 明天我们要来客人。

en: We take the Asahi and Yomiuri.
zh: 我们订了《朝日新闻》和《读卖新闻》。

en: We take a newspaper.
zh: 我们订了一份报纸。

en: We keep three cats, a black one and two white ones.
zh: 我们家养了三只猫，一只黑的，两只白的。

en: We are a family of five.
zh: 我们家有五口人。

en: My family goes skiing every winter.
zh: 我们家每年冬天都去滑雪。

en: We have four bedrooms upstairs.
zh: 我们家楼上有四个卧室。

en: Our home is a condominium.
zh: 我们家住的是公寓。

en: Would you please stop singing so loudly? This is not a cheap drinking place.
zh: 能不能请你别唱那么大声？这儿又不是什么廉价小酒馆。

en: Our refrigerator is out of order.
zh: 我们家的冰箱坏了。

en: Our budget won't allow that luxury.
zh: 我们的预算买不起那么奢侈的东西。

en: My daughter has reached a marriageable age.
zh: 我女儿到了该谈婚论嫁的年纪了。

en: Jumping rope is my daughter's favorite.
zh: 跳绳是我女儿的最爱。

en: Can you find the time to play with our daughter?
zh: 你能抽点时间陪我女儿玩会儿吗？

en: My mother doesn't care for our neighbor very much.
zh: 我妈不太喜欢我们的邻居。

en: My mother is active.
zh: 我妈这人挺好动的。

en: My mother is certain to say no.
zh: 我妈肯定会说不的。

en: My father doesn't let me go out alone at night.
zh: 我爸不让我晚上一个人出门。

en: My watchdog is alert to the slightest sound and movement.
zh: 我的看门狗对任何风吹草动都特别警觉。

en: Our cat is very fond of seaweed.
zh: 我们的猫特别喜欢吃海苔。

en: Our cat is in the kitchen.
zh: 我们的猫在厨房里。

en: My cat is such a baby, she follows me around wherever I go.
zh: 我的猫特别粘人，我走到哪儿它就跟到哪儿。

en: Our telephone is out of order so I shall have it repaired.
zh: 我们家的电话坏了，我得找人修一下。

en: There seems to be something wrong with our telephone.
zh: 我们家的电话好像出问题了。

en: My little brother gets delirious when he's sleepy. He says the weirdest things.
zh: 我弟一困就爱胡言乱语，说些稀奇古怪的话。

en: We have just a tiny bit of garden.
zh: 我们家就一丁点儿大的院子。

en: Our garden was full of weeds.
zh: 我们家院子里以前全是杂草。

en: There is a small pond in our garden.
zh: 我们家院子里有个小池塘。

en: The roses are in bloom in our garden.
zh: 我们家院子里的玫瑰花开了。

en: My husband isn't quite the provider he should be.
zh: 我老公不太能养家糊口。

en: Let's not wash our dirty linen in public.
zh: 家丑不可外扬。

en: Our college uses far too much electricity.
zh: 我们学校用电太费了。

en: Our university has excellent sports facilities.
zh: 我们大学的体育设施特别棒。

en: My son is just idling.
zh: 我儿子整天无所事事的。

en: My son has formed the habit of rising early.
zh: 我儿子养成了早起的习惯。

en: Our son was killed in action.
zh: 我儿子在战斗中牺牲了。

en: My son is taller than me.
zh: 我儿子比我高。

en: My son grew 5 inches last year.
zh: 我儿子去年长高了五英寸。

en: My boy can't do addition properly yet.
zh: 我家儿子还不太会做加法。

en: Every dog is a lion at home.
zh: 狗在家里都是狮子。

en: Our family has some distinguished ancestors.
zh: 我们家祖上出过一些了不起的人物。

en: Our teacher is always on time for class.
zh: 我们老师上课从不迟到。

en: Our baby is learning to speak.
zh: 我们家宝宝正在学说话。

en: Our baby is not yet articulate.
zh: 我们家宝宝说话还不大利索。

en: When it comes to my supervisor, he's very inconsistent, so we never get any work done.
zh: 我那个主管做事老是变来变去的，搞得我们什么活儿也干不成。

en: Our car is being repaired at the auto shop.
zh: 我们的车在修理厂修着呢。

en: The car is acting up again.
zh: 这车又出毛病了。

en: Our car is equipped with air conditioning.
zh: 我们的车里有空调。

en: I suppose we're a little too indulgent to the dog.
zh: 我觉得我们对这只狗有点太娇惯了。

en: My boss is very cheerful today.
zh: 我老板今天心情特别好。

en: Our boss is hard to please.
zh: 我们老板挺难伺候的。

en: My children make pathetically sincere efforts to get up early.
zh: 我家孩子为了早起，真是费了老大的劲儿。

en: Our children are independent of us.
zh: 我们的孩子都很独立，不依赖我们。

en: Our children all go to the local school.
zh: 我们家孩子都在当地的学校上学。

en: All our children are immune to measles.
zh: 我家孩子都对麻疹有免疫力。

en: Our children are anxious to have bicycles like those of the children next door.
zh: 我家孩子特别想要邻居小孩那样的自行车。

en: Our little children were taken care of by the babysitter.
zh: 我们的几个小孩是保姆在照看。

en: Our baby cannot talk yet.
zh: 我们家宝宝还不会说话。

en: Our principal is accessible to students.
zh: 我们校长挺随和的，学生随时能找他。

en: Our dog is in the kennel.
zh: 我们家的狗在狗窝里。

en: Our dog has been lying in the sun all day.
zh: 我们的狗在太阳底下趴了一整天。

en: We call our dog Johnnie.
zh: 我们管自家的狗叫‘强尼’。

en: My dog is the bigger of the two.
zh: 我那只狗是两只里比较大的那个。

en: Our dog, which is named John, barks at anybody.
zh: 我们家那只叫约翰的狗，见谁都叫。

en: Our dog has gone away.
zh: 我们的狗跑丢了。

en: My cat and dog get along.
zh: 我家的猫和狗相处得挺好的。

en: Our dog seldom bites.
zh: 我们的狗很少咬人。

en: Let's cut down our expenses.
zh: 咱们得缩减开支了。

en: A fire broke out in a neighborhood hotel.
zh: 附近的一家旅馆着火了。

en: There is a big supermarket in my neighborhood.
zh: 我家附近有个大超市。

en: Our cow doesn't give us any milk.
zh: 我们家那头牛不产奶。

en: Our company is too top-heavy.
zh: 我们公司机构臃肿，官多兵少。

en: Our firm is on the verge of bankruptcy, I'm ashamed to say.
zh: 说来惭愧，我们公司快破产了。

en: The longer you stay, the more overtime pay you'll get.
zh: 你加班的时间越长，拿到的加班费就越多。

en: We are affiliated with the new joint venture company.
zh: 我们是那家新合资公司的下属企业。

en: There are some foreign workers in my company as well.
zh: 我们公司也有一些外籍员工。

en: There is no opening in our firm.
zh: 我们公司现在没有职位空缺。

en: Who is the best singer in our company?
zh: 我们公司谁唱歌最好听？

en: He was the first to jump into the world of computers at our company.
zh: 他是我们公司第一个进入电脑领域的人。

en: Little did I dream that we would expand our business to the U.S.
zh: 我压根没想到我们会把生意扩张到美国。

en: Our section chief always makes a face at me when I ask him for something.
zh: 每次我找我们科长办事，他总是给我摆臭脸。

en: All my family were just crazy about baseball.
zh: 我们全家人以前都对棒球特别着迷。

en: My family are all early risers.
zh: 我们全家人起得都很早。

en: Cooking runs in my family.
zh: 我们家的人都很会做菜。

en: Our best negotiators always drive a hard bargain.
zh: 我们最厉害的谈判专家总是能谈下很苛刻的条件。

en: This condo is getting old. Why don't we redecorate to give it a fresh feel?
zh: 这公寓旧了，咱们重新装修一下换个感觉吧？

en: Our boss is very sweet on the new girl.
zh: 我们老板对新来的那个女孩挺有意思的。

en: Our basketball team is recruiting tall boys.
zh: 我们的篮球队正在招个头高的男生。

en: Our TV is out of order.
zh: 我们家的电视坏了。

en: The chances are very good that our team will win.
zh: 我们队赢的可能性很大。

en: I'll eat my hat if, by some chance, my team loses to yours.
zh: 要是我们队真输给了你们队，我名字倒着写。

en: All the members of our club, excluding me, are men.
zh: 除了我，我们俱乐部的人全都是男的。

en: The air conditioner is out of order.
zh: 空调坏了。

en: My wife used to be a pro-wrestler, so if she ever catches me two-timing her, I'd be beaten to a pulp.
zh: 我老婆以前是职业摔跤手，要是被她发现我劈腿，非把我打个半死不可。

en: My grandmother lives by herself.
zh: 我奶奶一个人住。

en: My grandfather has never consulted a doctor in his life.
zh: 我爷爷这辈子都没看过医生。

en: Won't you come over to my place?
zh: 来我这儿坐坐不？

en: Would you like to come eat at our house?
zh: 要不要来我家吃顿饭？

en: We have only a small garden.
zh: 我们家就一个小院子。

en: We have ten cattle.
zh: 我们家有十头牛。

en: We have three dogs, one white and two black.
zh: 我们家有三只狗，一只白的，两只黑的。

en: We have a good heating system.
zh: 我们家的供暖挺好的。

en: Our house adjoins his.
zh: 我们家跟他家挨着。

en: Everything is all right at home.
zh: 家里一切都好。

en: We call our father Oyajisan.
zh: 我们管我爸叫“老头子”。

en: We have breakfast in the kitchen.
zh: 我们就在厨房吃早饭。

en: We all consider he's the cleverest dog in the world.
zh: 我们都觉得它是世界上最聪明的狗。

en: All are well at home.
zh: 家里人都挺好的。

en: We didn't have many visitors this summer.
zh: 今年夏天来串门的人不多。

en: She lives a block away and her name is Susan.
zh: 她住在隔壁街，叫苏珊。

en: It's sweltering.
zh: 热死人了。

en: He can't get on in the world.
zh: 他这辈子出不了头。

en: Never tell lies.
zh: 永远别撒谎。

en: Don't tell lies.
zh: 别撒谎。

en: It is not good to tell a lie.
zh: 撒谎可不好。

en: I think it's wrong to tell a lie.
zh: 我觉得撒谎是不对的。

en: Telling lies is a very bad habit.
zh: 撒谎是个很坏的习惯。

en: Don't tell a lie. Be honest.
zh: 别撒谎，诚实点。

en: It is against my principles to tell a lie.
zh: 撒谎违背我的原则。

en: Is it always a sin to tell a lie?
zh: 难道撒谎永远都是错的吗？

en: She was indignant when I said she was lying.
zh: 我说她在撒谎，她当时就急眼了。

en: Because he lied, he was punished.
zh: 因为撒谎，他受罚了。

en: I feel guilty about having told a lie.
zh: 撒了谎，我心里挺过意不去的。

en: How about adding some Worcestershire sauce?
zh: 加点辣酱油怎么样？

en: I prepared a weak solution of sugar and water.
zh: 我兑了点淡糖水。

en: I feel guilty.
zh: 我很内疚。

en: Stop pushing me from behind!
zh: 别在后面推我！

en: The hare hid behind the tree.
zh: 兔子躲在了树后。

en: Rabbits breed quickly.
zh: 兔子繁殖得很快。

en: Rabbits like to eat carrots.
zh: 兔子喜欢吃胡萝卜。

en: Rabbits are related to beavers and squirrels.
zh: 兔子和海狸、松鼠是亲戚。

en: The hare was outdistanced by the tortoise.
zh: 兔子被乌龟甩在了后面。

en: A rabbit has long ears.
zh: 兔子的耳朵很长。

en: The ears of a rabbit are longer than those of a fox.
zh: 兔子的耳朵比狐狸的还要长。

en: A hare raced with a tortoise.
zh: 兔子和乌龟赛跑。

en: Even a rabbit, if badgered into a corner, will fight back.
zh: 兔子急了也咬人。

en: A rabbit is running in the garden.
zh: 院子里有只兔子在跑。

en: I heard a Japanese nightingale.
zh: 我听到了莺叫。

en: The Ugandans depend on their coffee crop to bring money into the country.
zh: 乌干达人主要靠种咖啡来给国家挣外汇。

en: You look gloomy.
zh: 你看起来闷闷不乐的。

en: I missed it inadvertently.
zh: 我一个不留神就给错过了。

en: Please rinse often with mouthwash.
zh: 记得多用漱口水漱漱口。

en: Walter was taken aback by John's cruel insult.
zh: 约翰那番狠毒的羞辱让沃尔特吃了一惊。

en: Walter Mondale ran for President.
zh: 沃尔特·蒙代尔参加了总统竞选。

en: A vodka martini, please.
zh: 请给我来杯伏特加马提尼。

en: I'd like a vodka and tonic.
zh: 我想来杯伏特加汤力。

en: Mr Wall put off going to the dentist's.
zh: 沃尔先生一直拖着没去看牙医。

en: Rumors of a Wall Street crash sparked a dollar selling spree.
zh: 华尔街股市崩盘的传闻引发了抛售美元的风潮。

en: All right! Everybody around me is so encouraging I'm getting a rush of motivation.
zh: 太棒了！身边的人都这么鼓励我，我一下子动力十足。

en: Wendy was not always interested in Japanese festivals.
zh: 温迪以前并不总是对日本的节庆活动感兴趣。

en: Wendy, I'd like you to meet my brother Sam.
zh: 温迪，给你介绍一下，这是我兄弟萨姆。

en: The population of Wellington is only about one fortieth that of Tokyo.
zh: 惠灵顿的人口差不多只有东京的四十分之一。

en: Mrs. West is busy getting breakfast ready.
zh: 韦斯特太太正忙着张罗早饭呢。

en: Mr. and Mrs. West are on their honeymoon.
zh: 韦斯特夫妇正在度蜜月呢。

en: Professor West is almost as old as my father.
zh: 韦斯特教授跟我爸年纪差不多。

en: Welcome to the town of Westhampton.
zh: 欢迎来到西汉普顿镇。

en: We're chosen by the people of Westhamptonshire County to be members of the council.
zh: 我们是被西汉普顿郡的民众选进委员会的。

en: What is your waist size?
zh: 你腰围多大？

en: In Wales we have a proverb.
zh: 在我们威尔士有句谚语。

en: The waitress spread a white cloth over the table.
zh: 服务员在桌上铺了一块白台布。

en: The waitress set a glass of juice in front of me.
zh: 服务员在我面前放了一杯果汁。

en: Waiter, I'd like to order.
zh: 服务员，我要点菜。

en: Waitress, I'd like to order.
zh: 服务员，我想点下单。

en: The waitress bustled about serving the customers.
zh: 服务员正忙前忙后地招呼客人们。

en: The waiter helped the lady with the chair.
zh: 服务员帮那位女士拉了一下椅子。

en: The waiter filled our glasses to the brim.
zh: 服务员把我们的杯子都给倒满了。

en: Hm, that's a good idea. Let's go there.
zh: 嗯，好主意。咱们就去那儿吧。

en: I can't come up with a good idea.
zh: 我实在想不出什么好主意。

en: No, thank you. I'm full.
zh: 不用了，谢谢，我吃饱了。

en: Hmm. I have a feeling I'm going to get lost whichever road I take.
zh: 唉，我有种预感，不管走哪条路我都会迷路。

en: Wool takes a dye well.
zh: 羊毛挺容易上色的。

en: Women's Liberation is a broad-based but informal popular movement.
zh: 妇女解放是一项基础广泛但非正式的民众运动。

en: Whoo! Today's practice is tough - much harder than usual.
zh: 哇！今天的训练真够呛，比平时累多了。

en: Ummm. I have no idea how to answer the teacher's question.
zh: 呃……我真不知道该怎么回答老师的问题。

en: Wimbledon has eighteen grass courts, including the Center Court.
zh: 温网一共有18个草地球场，包括那个中央球场。

en: The men's and women's singles finals at Wimbledon are among the most exciting and popular sports events of the year.
zh: 温网的男女单打决赛是一年里最让人兴奋、也是最受欢迎的体育盛事。

en: At Wimbledon there are now special electronic machines to judge the serves.
zh: 现在温网都有专门的电子仪器来判定发球了。

en: With Windows, you have to have extensions or it won't read your files.
zh: 用Windows的话，你得有扩展名，不然它读不了你的文件。

en: Windows 95 crashed on me AGAIN!
zh: Windows 95又给我死机了！

en: A wink was his only answer.
zh: 他只是眨了眨眼，算是回答了。

en: Mr Wilson made us repeat the sentence several times.
zh: 威尔逊先生让我们把这句子重复了好几遍。

en: Wilson's solution is similar to Hudson's in that they used the same constants.
zh: 威尔逊的解法和哈德逊的差不多，因为他们用的常数是一样的。

en: Mr Wilson likes him to play square.
zh: 威尔逊先生喜欢他做事规规矩矩的。

en: Mr Wilson is angry with Dennis.
zh: 威尔逊先生正跟丹尼斯生气呢。

en: Mr Wilson is proud of his house.
zh: 威尔逊先生对他那房子挺自豪的。

en: Go and see if Mr Wilson is at home.
zh: 去看看威尔逊先生在不在家。

en: Viruses will exist as long as man.
zh: 只要有人类存在，病毒就会一直存在。

en: Willie accidentally let off his father's shotgun and made a hole in the wall.
zh: 威利不小心把他爸的猎枪弄走火了，在墙上打了个洞。

en: Mr. and Mrs. Williams adopted a child whose parents were dead.
zh: 威廉姆斯夫妇领养了一个父母双亡的孩子。

en: Mr Williams carries that section.
zh: 威廉姆斯先生负责那一块。

en: I didn't know that Mr. Williams fought in the Vietnam War.
zh: 我不知道威廉姆斯先生参加过越战。

en: William Tell shot an arrow at the apple on his son's head.
zh: 威廉·退尔一箭射向他儿子头上的苹果。

en: I have a bottle of whiskey.
zh: 我有一瓶威士忌。

en: Whiskey goes very well with tea.
zh: 威士忌配茶非常搭。

en: A heavy tax was imposed on whiskey.
zh: 威士忌被征收了重税。

en: How long does it take to get to Vienna on foot?
zh: 走路去维也纳要多久？

en: Vienna is a beautiful city.
zh: 维也纳是个美丽的城市。

en: The Van Horn family was in the chips.
zh: 范霍恩家族那时候非常有钱。

en: The inflation issue split the party.
zh: 通货膨胀问题导致了党派分裂。

en: The rate of inflation is slowing down.
zh: 通胀率正在放缓。

en: Excessive reliance on monetary policy an attempt to curb inflation could unnecessarily constrain credit and hence business.
zh: 过度依赖货币政策来抑制通胀可能会不必要地限制信贷，进而影响业务。

en: Inflation should be checked.
zh: 通胀应该得到控制。

en: It's an inflation-adjusted figure.
zh: 这是通胀调整后的数字。

en: Inflation is getting out of control.
zh: 通货膨胀快要失控了。

en: Inflation is down.
zh: 通胀降下来了。

en: The value of the dollar declines as the rate of inflation rises.
zh: 随着通胀率上升，美元在贬值。

en: Because of inflation, salaries can't keep up with the high cost of living.
zh: 由于通胀，工资涨幅跟不上高昂的生活成本。

en: Prices are high.

en: The absent are always in the wrong.
zh: 谁不在场谁理亏。

en: Never speak ill of others behind their backs.
zh: 别在背后说人坏话。

en: There is nothing to it.
zh: 这没什么难的。

en: First cousins are too close for marriage.
zh: 堂表亲结婚血缘太近了。

en: My cousin is the last man but one in the line.
zh: 我表弟排在倒数第二个。

en: My cousin is having a baby next month.
zh: 我表姐下个月要生孩子了。

en: My cousin took me by surprise by coming without previous notice.
zh: 我表哥没打招呼就来了，吓了我一跳。

en: My cousin took me around the town.
zh: 我表弟带我在镇上逛了逛。

en: My cousin works in a shop near our home.
zh: 我表哥在我们家附近的店里工作。

en: We are cousins.
zh: 我们是表亲。

en: My cousin Teddy majored in French in college and studied in Paris for one year.
zh: 我表弟泰迪大学专业是法语，并在巴黎学习了一年。

en: My cousins are coming in a few days.
zh: 我的几个表亲过几天要来。

en: I'll ask when the train will get in.
zh: 我去问问火车什么时候到。

en: When will you go on a journey?
zh: 你什么时候去旅行？

en: When did you get back from your trip?
zh: 你什么时候旅行回来的？

en: Whenever you come, you are always welcome.
zh: 你什么时候来我都随时欢迎。

en: You will find him home whenever you call.
zh: 你什么时候去找他，他都在家。

en: Whenever you come, you are welcome.
zh: 你什么时候来我都欢迎。

en: It doesn't matter when you come.
zh: 你什么时候来都行。

en: Whenever come, I'll play go with you.
zh: 你什么时候来，我都陪你下围棋。

en: I'm ready whenever you may come.
zh: 你什么时候来我都准备好了。

en: No matter when you come, I'll play a game of Japanese chess with you.
zh: 不管你什么时候来，我都陪你下盘将棋。

en: How long have they been here?
zh: 他们来这儿多久了？

en: When did you get back?
zh: 你什么时候回来的？

en: When are you coming back?
zh: 你什么时候回来？

en: When did Democracy come into existence?
zh: 民主制度是什么时候出现的？

en: When is she to go abroad?
zh: 她什么时候出国？

en: When did you see her?
zh: 你什么时候见她的？

en: When did you come to know her?
zh: 你是什么时候认识她的？

en: Whenever you may call on him, you will find him at his desk.
zh: 不管你什么时候去找他，他肯定都在办公桌前。

en: Whenever you may call on him, you will find that he is out.
zh: 不管你什么时候去找他，他都不在。

en: When did they go home?
zh: 他们什么时候回家的？

en: There is no telling when they will arrive.
zh: 谁也说不准他们什么时候到。

en: When will he be able to stand on his own feet?
zh: 他什么时候才能自立啊？

en: Tell me when to call at his office.
zh: 告诉我什么时候去他办公室。

en: I'd like to know when you can send it out.
zh: 我想知道你什么时候能寄出来。

en: How soon are you going shopping?
zh: 你还要多久去买东西？

en: When do you plan to leave for Japan?
zh: 你打算什么时候去日本？

en: When do you work?
zh: 你什么时候上班？

en: So, when is it convenient for you?
zh: 那你什么时候方便？

en: Whenever I call, he is out.
zh: 我每次找他，他都不在。

en: There is no telling when an earthquake will occur.
zh: 谁也说不准什么时候会地震。

en: Nobody knows when the earthquake will occur.
zh: 没人知道什么时候会地震。

en: Whenever I go by, Mt. Fuji is in the clouds.
zh: 我每次经过，富士山都藏在云里。

en: War may break out at any moment.
zh: 战争随时可能爆发。

en: Nobody can foresee when the war will end.
zh: 谁也预料不到战争什么时候结束。

en: When were you born?
zh: 你是什么时候出生的？

en: Please let me know when you will come to Kobe.
zh: 你来神户的时候请告诉我一声。

en: I imagine that you are wondering when your new PC will arrive.
zh: 我想你一定在想你的新电脑什么时候能到。

en: Please tell me when to serve the food.
zh: 什么时候上菜请告诉我。

en: When will you harvest your wheat?
zh: 你们什么时候收麦子？

en: When will it suit you to start?
zh: 你什么时候方便开始？

en: Tell me when to start.
zh: 告诉我什么时候开始。

en: When to set off is a difficult problem.
zh: 什么时候出发是个难题。

en: When are you off?
zh: 你什么时候走？

en: When are you going to leave?
zh: 你打算什么时候走？

en: When to start is the main problem.
zh: 主要问题是什么时候开始。

en: Please tell me when to leave.
zh: 走的时候请告诉我。

en: Please inform me when to start.
zh: 开始的时候请通知我。

en: When will you get ready to leave?
zh: 你什么时候能准备好出发？

en: When will you leave?
zh: 你什么时候离开？

en: When should I finish my homework, Mr Jewel?
zh: Jewel先生，我什么时候该完成作业？

en: When did you change your address?
zh: 你什么时候搬的家？

en: When does it end?
zh: 什么时候结束？

en: When did you buy the watch?
zh: 这块表你是什么时候买的？

en: When did you miss your watch?
zh: 你什么时候发现表不见了的？

en: When will you bring back my umbrella?
zh: 你什么时候把雨伞还给我？

en: It could attack us at any moment.
zh: 它随时都可能攻击我们。

en: It is still undecided when we will begin.
zh: 我们什么时候开始还没定呢。

en: When will you get through with work?
zh: 你什么时候忙完？

en: When did you miss the purse?
zh: 你什么时候发现钱包不见了的？

en: When can you let me know the result?
zh: 你什么时候能告诉我结果？

en: When will they arrive?
zh: 他们什么时候到？

en: When did you graduate from high school?
zh: 你什么时候高中毕业的？

en: Would you tell me when to get off?
zh: 能告诉我该哪站下吗？

en: Would you please tell me when to get off?
zh: 麻烦您到站时提醒我一声好吗？

en: Please tell me when to go.
zh: 走的时候请告诉我一声。

en: When shall we go?
zh: 我们什么时候走？

en: When do you want to go?
zh: 你想什么时候去？

en: When was it built?
zh: 这什么时候建的？

en: When are you going to say, I do?
zh: 你打算什么时候结婚？

en: When are you planning to tie the knot?
zh: 你打算什么时候结婚？

en: When will they turn off the no-smoking sign?
zh: 禁烟标志什么时候关掉？

en: When did you get to Kyoto?
zh: 你什么时候到的京都？

en: What time did you come home?
zh: 你几点回家的？

en: I don't know exactly when I will be back.
zh: 我也说不准什么时候能回来。

en: He hasn't told me when he will return.
zh: 他还没跟我说他什么时候回来。

en: When did you open your new store?
zh: 你的新店什么时候开的？

en: When did you return?
zh: 你什么时候回来的？

en: Every time I see him, he is smiling.
zh: 我每次见到他，他都在笑。

en: A war may break out at any moment.
zh: 战争随时可能爆发。

en: It may rain at any time.
zh: 随时都可能下雨。

en: It may rain at any moment.
zh: 天随时都可能下雨。

en: When are you going to leave for London?
zh: 你什么时候出发去伦敦？

en: When did you get back from London?
zh: 你什么时候从伦敦回来的？

en: When do we hand in the report?
zh: 我们什么时候交报告？

en: When did you go to Rome?
zh: 你什么时候去的罗马？

en: When are you going to Europe?
zh: 你什么时候去欧洲？

en: Tell me when to stop.
zh: 该停的时候告诉我。

en: What do you usually do after dinner?
zh: 你吃完晚饭通常做什么？

en: I always keep my word.
zh: 我说话一向算数。

en: You should always keep your word.
zh: 你应该说话算数。

en: I always feel sleepy.
zh: 我总觉得困。

en: The member of the family who is always in trouble is the black sheep.
zh: 家里那个总是惹祸的是害群之马。

en: You must always tell the truth.
zh: 你必须说实话。

en: You don't have to tell the truth all the time.
zh: 你不需要一直说实话。

en: I always read myself to sleep.
zh: 我总是看书看睡着。

en: I always have an uncomfortable feeling.
zh: 我总有一种不舒服的感觉。

en: They are always complaining.
zh: 他们总是在抱怨。

en: I'm always moody.
zh: 我这人总是情绪化。

en: He is cross because she always comes late.
zh: 他很生气，因为她总是迟到。

en: He is always laughing.
zh: 他总是笑呵呵的。

en: He is always full of power.
zh: 他总是精力充沛。

en: I always need an extra blanket in the wintertime.
zh: 冬天我总得加条毯子。

en: I always keep my deadlines.
zh: 我总能按时完成任务。

en: It isn't as if I'm learning by being corrected all the time.
zh: 我又不是一直被纠正才学会的。

en: If you always travel by subway, you seldom surface other than at your stop.
zh: 如果你老是坐地铁，除了到站，你很少会去地面。

en: And every day the boy would come and he would gather her leaves and make them into crowns and play king of the forest.
zh: 男孩每天都会来，收集她的叶子，把它们编成王冠，玩森林之王的游戏。

en: To be always honest is not easy.
zh: 一直保持诚实并不容易。

en: It's not easy being honest all the time.
zh: 总保持诚实真不容易。

en: I'm always very nervous.
zh: 我老是很紧张。

en: We have to be ready not only for a straightforward test of strength, but also for a struggle in which every strategy comes into play.
zh: 我们不仅要准备好硬碰硬，还要准备好面对一场斗智斗勇的较量。

en: Always have your dictionary near at hand.
zh: 词典要一直放在手边。

en: Keep your hands clean.
zh: 保持手干净。

en: Always be true to yourself.
zh: 永远要对自己诚实。

en: We must always consider the feelings of others.
zh: 我们总得替别人想想。

en: People who talk about themselves all the time bore me.
zh: 那些老是说自己的人让我觉得很无聊。

en: Keep the dictionary ready at hand.
zh: 把词典放在手边。

en: Always keep your office tidy.
zh: 办公室要一直保持整洁。

en: I've been thinking about marriage a lot, and I think we should just do it.
zh: 我最近一直在考虑结婚的事，我觉得咱们干脆结了吧。

en: I say it all the time.
zh: 我老这么说。

en: Come whenever you like.
zh: 你想什么时候来都行。

en: I'm always under pressure.
zh: 我一直压力很大。

en: I write articles regularly.
zh: 我经常写文章。

en: I always study hard.
zh: 我学习一直很刻苦。

en: How is it that you are always late for school?
zh: 你怎么老是上学迟到？

en: It isn't always summer.
zh: 总不会一直是夏天。

en: What time do you usually have breakfast?
zh: 你平时几点吃早饭？

en: What's always on your mind?
zh: 你老在想什么呢？

en: You always take the lion's share!
zh: 你总是占大头！

en: I always work alone. I'm just not a team player.
zh: 我一直都是单干，不适合团队合作。

en: You should always keep a broad perspective on the work you do.
zh: 你做工作的时候眼光要放长远点。

en: I urinate more often than usual.
zh: 我比平时尿得勤。

en: I arrived later than usual.
zh: 我来得比平时晚。

en: Mary invariably brought more food than she could eat.
zh: 玛丽总是带特别多吃的，她根本吃不完。

en: Always keep a handkerchief in your pocket.
zh: 兜里要一直带块手帕。

en: He is always writing about journey to other planets.
zh: 他老是写关于去外星球旅行的东西。

en: I missed my usual train.
zh: 我没赶上平时坐的那班车。

en: She generally sings very well, but now she is singing very badly.
zh: 她平时唱得挺好的，但现在唱得真差。

en: It's because I missed my usual train.
zh: 那是因为我没赶上平时坐的那班车。

en: She came late as usual.
zh: 她跟往常一样来晚了。

en: I'll be waiting for you at the usual place.
zh: 我会在老地方等你。

en: I tried harder than usual, so I'm all the more exhausted.
zh: 我比平时更努力，所以现在格外累。

en: Always keep this dictionary handy.
zh: 把这本词典放在手边。

en: As usual, he got up early in the morning and jogged.
zh: 他跟往常一样，一大早就起床去跑步了。

en: As usual, he was the last to arrive at the theater.
zh: 他跟往常一样，是最后一个到剧院的。

en: It is imperative that you be on time as usual.
zh: 你一定要像往常一样准时。

en: As usual, he was late and made us wait for a long time.
zh: 他跟往常一样迟到了，让我们等了好久。

en: As usual the peasants are busy scattering grain seeds.
zh: 农民们正像往常一样忙着播种。

en: He may have missed his usual bus.
zh: 他可能没赶上平时坐的那班公交车。

en: As usual, Mike turned up on time. He's very punctual.
zh: 迈克跟往常一样准时到了，他非常守时。

en: I met the usual people at the usual place.
zh: 我在老地方见到了那些老面孔。

en: I'm always thirsty.
zh: 我老是觉得口渴。

en: As is usual, Bob came to school late this morning.
zh: 鲍勃跟往常一样，今天早上上学迟到了。

en: As usual, his thoughts were extremely academic.
zh: 跟往常一样，他的想法总是非常有学究气。

en: We were served French champagne, not to mention the usual cocktails.
zh: 更别说平时的鸡尾酒了，我们还喝到了法国香槟。

en: My regular waitress wouldn't have anything to do with me.
zh: 那个经常招待我的服务员都不理我了。

en: Let's occasionally change where we go to eat out.
zh: 咱们偶尔换个地方下馆子吧。

en: Some children play video games all the time.
zh: 有些孩子整天都在玩电子游戏。

en: We're always going there! Let's go to a French restaurant for a change.
zh: 咱们老是去那儿！换个口味，去吃法国菜吧。

en: I'm always under stress.
zh: 我压力一直很大。

en: Fasten your seat belt at all times.
zh: 随时系好安全带。

en: Is it always so crowded here?
zh: 这儿一直都这么多人吗？

en: He was the kind of kid who was always showing off to his classmates.
zh: 他就是那种老爱跟同学显摆的小孩。

en: You can't win them all.
zh: 你不可能每次都赢。

en: You're always there for me, so if you're ever in dire straits, just let me know and I'll come running.
zh: 你一直都挺照顾我的，所以你要是真遇到什么难处了，尽管跟我说，我肯定立马过来帮。

en: I always feel gloomy.
zh: 我总觉得心情很郁郁寡欢。

en: She was always able to answer all the questions.
zh: 她总是能回答出所有的问题。

en: That place is always crowded, but I reserved a table today, so we don't have to worry.
zh: 那儿人一直很多，但我今天订了位子，所以咱们不用担心。

en: I always wanted to see you.
zh: 我一直都想见你。

en: I regularly go to bed at nine.
zh: 我经常九点就睡觉了。

en: You always ask me to join your team because you need one more guy. Come on - just once I'd like you to say it's because I alone am worth ten of them - even if it is a lie.
zh: 你老是因为缺人才拉我进队。拜托，哪怕是撒个谎，我也想听你夸我一次，说我一个顶十个。

en: How long are you staying in Japan?
zh: 你要在日本待多久？

en: How long are you going to stay in Japan?
zh: 你打算在日本待多久？

en: Until when will you be in Japan?
zh: 你在日本待到什么时候？

en: How long will you stay in Tokyo?
zh: 你要在东京住多久？

en: How long will you be staying here?
zh: 你要在这儿待多久？

en: I'd stop worrying about it and take some action. The anxiety that comes from doing nothing is worse than any danger you might face.
zh: 要是我，我就不瞎操心了，直接行动。什么都不做在那儿焦虑，比面临危险还难受。

en: Stop being such a hard-ass. Come on over.
zh: 别那么死脑筋了，过来吧。

en: Are you going to cry till the cows come home?
zh: 你还要哭到什么时候啊？

en: I will love you forever.
zh: 我会永远爱你。

en: You can complain 'til the cows come home, but it's not going to make a bit of difference.
zh: 你就算抱怨到天荒地老也没用。

en: That secret can't be kept forever.
zh: 那个秘密不可能守得住一辈子的。

en: I wish you a long and happy married life.
zh: 祝你们白头偕老。

en: How long are you going to keep whimpering about that? You can't change the past.
zh: 这事儿你打算哼唧到什么时候？过去的事儿又改不了。

en: When are you going to stop laughing like an idiot?
zh: 你打算傻笑到什么时候？

en: How soon do you need it?
zh: 你什么时候要？

en: How soon will you be able to finish the task?
zh: 你多久能完成任务？

en: You can wait till the cows come home.
zh: 你慢慢等吧，等到天荒地老也等不着。

en: Until when are you staying?
zh: 你待到什么时候？

en: How long are you staying?
zh: 你待多久？

en: When will this machine be put in motion again?
zh: 这机器什么时候能重新转起来？

en: When are you leaving for Boston?
zh: 你什么时候出发去波士顿？

en: On the other hand, he had a different opinion.
zh: 另一方面，他有不同的看法。

en: You must bring the full glass with you.
zh: 你得带上这满满一满杯。

en: When did you come to Paris?
zh: 你什么时候来的巴黎？

en: When shall we leave for the party?
zh: 咱们什么时候出发去派对？

en: Read such books as will be useful some day.
zh: 多读点以后派得上用处的书吧。

en: Some day man will reclaim the desert for agriculture.
zh: 总有一天，人类会把沙漠变成农田。

en: Before I knew it, I couldn't see the birds.
zh: 一没留神，我就看不见那些鸟了。

en: Summer has gone all too soon.
zh: 夏天一转眼就过去了。

en: Bob went out before I knew it.
zh: 我一没留神，鲍勃就出去了。

en: So, when are you going to break down and buy a house?
zh: 所以，你到底什么时候才肯松口买房啊？

en: Your dream may come true at any moment.
zh: 你的梦想随时都可能实现。

en: When and where did the war break out?
zh: 战争是什么时候、在哪儿爆发的？

en: When and where did you buy that old clock?
zh: 那个旧钟你是啥时候在哪儿买的？

en: I don't remember when and where I met you.
zh: 我不记得啥时候在哪儿见过你了。

en: You will always find a good friend in me.
zh: 我永远是你的好朋友。

en: Come and see me whenever you want to.
zh: 想见我随时过来。

en: Please come and see me any time.
zh: 请随时过来坐坐。

en: Come and see me any time you like.
zh: 你想什么时候来见我都行。

en: Always tell the truth.
zh: 永远要说实话。

en: You can always ask for his help.
zh: 你随时可以找他帮忙。

en: She always gives an instant answer.
zh: 她总是马上就给答复。

en: You can come whenever it is convenient for you.
zh: 你什么时候方便就什么时候过来。

en: You can count on me any time.
zh: 你随时可以信任我。

en: Please call me at any time.
zh: 随时给我打电话。

en: You cannot always have your own way.
zh: 你不能老是想怎么样就怎么样。

en: We're ready to leave.
zh: 咱们可以走了。

en: You should always apologize in person.
zh: 你总该亲自去道个歉。

en: You can always count on me.
zh: 你永远可以相信我。

en: Any time will suit me.
zh: 我什么时候都行。

en: You can borrow my car anytime.
zh: 我的车你随时可以借去开。

en: You may always use my dictionary.
zh: 我的词典你随时可以用。

en: You'll always have a roof over your head.
zh: 你总有个遮风挡雨的地方。

en: You may use my typewriter at any time.
zh: 我的打字机你随时可以用。

en: Call at my office at any time.
zh: 随时来我办公室找我。

en: You may call me anytime.
zh: 你随时可以给我打电话。

en: I'm always at your service.

zh: 反正我尽到责任了。

en: In any case, you have to leave early, whether you like it or not.
zh: 不管你愿不愿意，反正你得早点走。

en: In either case, the division is real and useful; but it can also be misleading.
zh: 无论是哪种情况，这种划分都很管用，但也可能让人产生误解。

en: In any case, catch the train tomorrow.
zh: 反正明天一定要赶上火车。

en: At any rate, he was satisfied with the results.
zh: 不管怎么说，他对结果还算满意。

en: At any rate I will go out when it stops raining.
zh: 反正雨一停我就出门。

en: At any rate, it will be a good experience for you.
zh: 无论如何，这对你来说都会是个很好的经历。

en: At any rate, we can't change the schedule.
zh: 反正我们没法改时间表了。

en: It is not my intent to hurt you in any way.
zh: 我真的不是故意要伤害你的。

en: In any case, you are wrong in your conjecture.
zh: 反正你猜得不对。

en: At any rate, we have no means of helping him.
zh: 不管怎么说，我们也帮不了他。

en: Anyway, if you want to know more about my country, I'll send you a letter when I get home.
zh: 反正如果你想多了解我的国家，我到家后会给你写信的。

en: Eventually I'd like to settle down and have a family, but not yet.
zh: 我以后想安顿下来成个家，但现在还不急。

en: I will get in touch with you.
zh: 我会跟你联系的。

en: Anyway, we'll talk it over tomorrow.
zh: 反正咱们明天再商量吧。

en: Soviet and Western observers have warned that if the Muslim republics do not join the commonwealth, they may from a separate group, setting up a volatile ethnic and religious split.
zh: 苏联和西方的观察家警告说，要是这些穆斯林共和国不加入联邦，可能会自立门户，造成动荡的种族和宗教分裂。

en: The makeup of Mideast peace talks may change due to a change of heart on the part of Israel.
zh: 因为以色列改变了主意，中东和谈的人员构成可能会有变动。

en: Leave the chairs as they are.
zh: 椅子就原样放着吧。

en: Please use this wooden box in place of a chair.
zh: 请拿这个木箱子当椅子用吧。

en: The joints of the chair were loose.
zh: 椅子的榫头松了。

en: There is a cat on the chair.
zh: 椅子上有一只猫。

en: I found a pair of gloves under the chair.
zh: 我在椅子底下发现了一副手套。

en: Make sure that chair is firm before you sit on it.
zh: 坐之前确认一下那椅子稳不稳。

en: Don't scrape your chair on the floor.
zh: 别在地板上拖椅子。

en: The chair is broken. You'd better get someone to fix it.
zh: 椅子坏了，你最好找人修一下。

en: The harassed mule got his back up and began kicking up dust.
zh: 那头被惹毛了的骡子发了脾气，开始乱踢，弄得尘土飞扬。

en: When it comes to dancing, nobody can move like Michael Jackson.
zh: 要说跳舞，没人能像迈克尔·杰克逊那样。

en: When it was time to vote, he abstained.
zh: 该投票的时候，他弃权了。

en: Aunt Isabel is generous and gave us a lot of presents.
zh: 伊莎贝尔阿姨人很大方，送了我们好多礼物。

en: Isadora Duncan danced with such grace that she was invited to dance in Europe.
zh: 邓肯跳得特别优雅，甚至被请去欧洲表演。

en: Your courage will come out in a crisis.
zh: 到了紧急关头，就能看出你的胆量了。

en: My courage failed me at the crucial moment.
zh: 关键时刻我没勇气了。

en: My umbrella will serve for a weapon, should the occasion arise.
zh: 万一有需要，我的雨伞也能拿来当武器。

en: This will come in handy in a pinch.
zh: 关键时刻这玩意儿挺管用的。

en: The wind failed us.
zh: 风停了，不给力了。

en: My resolution dissolved at the last moment.
zh: 到最后一刻我还是动摇了。

en: Save money against the unexpected for when it's necessary.
zh: 存点钱以备不时之需。

en: Put aside money for a rainy day.
zh: 存点钱，留着以后急用。

en: Quarrelling spoiled our unity.
zh: 吵架破坏了我们的团结。

en: It's really nice having you here, Isao.
zh: 功，你能在这儿真好。

en: I watched the film named "Texas Chainsaw Massacre" with my girlfriend yesterday. She was very afraid.
zh: 昨天我跟我女朋友看了《德州电锯杀人狂》，她被吓得不轻。

en: The boss is hard to get along with. But if I try to talk to him about problems I have at work he might have a little heart. Even a hunter can't kill a bird who flies to him for protection.
zh: 老板很难相处，但如果我跟他聊聊工作上的困难，说不定他会动点恻隐之心，毕竟“穷鸟入怀，仁者不杀”。

en: Many a day did she spend knitting a sweater for him.
zh: 她花了好些天给他织毛衣。

en: The Japanese distribution system, characterized by layers of wholesale, is complex and costly.
zh: 日本的流通体系层层批发，特别复杂，成本也高。

en: Even the best fish smell when they are three days old.
zh: 再好的鱼放三天也会臭。

en: No matter how old I get, I'll still have the energy to play ping-pong.
zh: 不管我多大年纪，打乒乓球的劲儿还是有的。

en: He will arrive by eight at the latest.
zh: 他最晚八点到。

en: Search as we would, we could not find it.
zh: 我们怎么找也找不着。

en: I haven't got the nerve to ask you for a loan.
zh: 我不好意思开口跟你借钱。

en: No matter how close we may be, I can not ask him to do that.
zh: 就算我们关系再好，我也没法开口让他做那件事。

en: Keep a tally of what you owe.
zh: 把你欠的账都记好。

en: I don't care how much you say you love me. I know your feelings for her haven't changed.
zh: 不管你说你有多爱我，我知道你对她的感情没变。

en: No matter how much you might think you like curry, three nights in a row is more than enough.
zh: 就算你再喜欢吃咖喱，连着吃三晚也够受了。

en: I've called and called, but there's no answer.
zh: 我打了一遍又一遍，可就是没人接。

en: You can't study too hard.
zh: 学习再怎么刻苦也不嫌多。

en: No amount of money will change his mind.
zh: 给他多少钱他都不会改变主意的。

en: However hard he worked, he did not become any better off.
zh: 不管他多努力干活，日子还是过得紧巴巴的。

en: No matter how hard you may try, you won't succeed so easily.
zh: 无论你多努力，想成功也没那么容易。

en: We cannot work too hard.
zh: 工作再努力也不过分。

en: Even in the worst case, she will not die of such an illness.
zh: 就算情况再糟，这种病也不至于要了她的命。

en: Try as you may, you will never get him to agree.
zh: 不管你怎么试，他都不会答应的。

en: Try as you may, you will find it impossible to give up that habit.
zh: 不管你怎么试，想戒掉那个习惯根本不可能。

en: Try as we may, we cannot swim to the rock.
zh: 不管我们怎么游，也游不到那块岩石那儿。

en: Try as you may, you can't master English in a few months.
zh: 就算再怎么努力，几个月内也是掌握不了英语的。

en: What price will you give for this?
zh: 这个你打算出多少钱？

en: However much she eats, she never gains weight.
zh: 她不管吃多少都不胖。

en: I always enjoy listening to classical music when I have some free time.
zh: 我有空的时候总喜欢听听古典音乐。

en: A number of books were stolen.
zh: 有好几本书被偷了。

en: I should be glad to be of any service to you.
zh: 我很乐意为您效劳。

en: I would be happy to be of any service to you.
zh: 我很愿意能帮上点忙。

en: We cannot finish it before Saturday even if everything goes well.
zh: 就算一切顺利，周六前我们也干不完。

en: After countless burials of the hatchet, we always dig it up again. There doesn't seem to be any sign of an ever-lasting peace.
zh: 讲和了无数次，最后总还是会闹翻，看来是没法太平了。

en: No matter the age, a child is a child.
zh: 不管多大，孩子终究还是个孩子。

en: I have some questions to ask, but I don't want to bother you now.
zh: 我有点问题想问，不过现在不想打扰你。

en: We ate several, but a good few were left.
zh: 我们吃了几个，但还剩不少呢。

en: May I ask some questions?
zh: 我能问几个问题吗？

en: Please permit me to ask you some questions.
zh: 请允许我问您几个问题。

en: The former is inferior to the latter in some respect.
zh: 前者在某些方面不如后者。

en: I don't like her in some ways.
zh: 我在某些方面不太喜欢她。

en: You are wrong in some respects.
zh: 你在某些地方想错了。

en: I'm not at one with you in some respects.
zh: 我在某些方面跟你的看法不一致。

en: He pointed out that the former was inferior to the latter in some respects.
zh: 他指出前者在某些方面不如后者。

en: Localities imposed bans on development.
zh: 各地都出台了禁止开发的规定。

en: Some fine phrases occurred to the poet.
zh: 诗人脑子里冒出了几个优美的句子。

en: Some species gradually develop elaborate repertoires of dozens or even hundreds of variants of a basic song.
zh: 有些物种逐渐进化出了一套复杂的鸣叫方式，能在一个基本曲调的基础上变幻出几十甚至几百种花样。

en: Some questions were asked me by the teacher.
zh: 老师问了我几个问题。

en: Some poems were also written by him.
zh: 他还写过几首诗。

en: Some difficulties hindered him from doing it.
zh: 一些困难让他没法把这件事做成。

en: Your writing is good except for a few mistakes.
zh: 除了几个小错误，你写的挺好的。

en: Some families spend their vacation near the beach.
zh: 有些家庭会去海边度假。

en: Some apples rotted on the tree.
zh: 有些苹果烂在树上了。

en: A combination of several mistakes led to the accident.
zh: 几个错误加在一起导致了这场事故。

en: Several teams are contending for the prize.
zh: 有好几支队伍在争夺这个奖项。

en: Please take some of them.
zh: 请拿几个吧。
